data.description: With the top/bottom thickness you can set the thickness of the solidly printed top and bottom layers of the print. A higher value ensures all gaps on the top and bottom layers are closed completely. However, this can also increase the print time and amount of filament used.
data.img_description: The model on the left has a top/bottom thickness of 1.4mm, the one on the right is just 0.7mm.
data.hints: - It is advised to always use a multiple of the layer height for the thickness of the top and bottom.
